title: Toddler drowned when mum left her alone in the bath
text:

Alia Tawfeeq was left in the bath at her home in Alderley Rise, Burslem, Stoke-on-Trent (Picture: Google)

A 17-month-old girl drowned after she was left unsupervised in the bath by her mother.

Little Alia Tawfeeq was alone while her mum was downstairs at their home in Stoke-on-Trent.

A post mortem revealed that her death in January 2017 was consistent with drowning.

Alia’s mum, Aarazoo Tawfeeq, was charged with manslaughter by gross negligence and due to stand trial.

She pleaded guilty to a charge of cruelty to a child, which was accepted by the Crown Prosecution Service.

The offence included instances of neglect and failure to protect a child as well as cases involving assault and ill-treatment.

Tawfeeq, who was 36 at the time of Alia’s death, received a nine-month prison sentence suspended for 12 months.

Yesterday, an inquest was held into the toddler’s death.

Assistant coroner Sarah Murphy said: ‘The deceased was in the bath while her mother was downstairs. The mother had not been constantly supervising the child.

‘The cause of death was drowning.’

The inquest at North Staffordshire Coroner’s Court had been adjourned until the end of criminal proceedings against Ms Tawfeeq.

Ms Murphy added: ‘Given the criminal proceedings where the facts surrounding the death have been heard in public I do not find sufficient reason to resume the inquest.

‘That concludes matters regarding the very sad death of Alia Tawfeeq.’
